text:
“Let me go!” Raskolnikov shouted, trying to push past Razumihin. 

Razumihin gripped his shoulder tightly. “Let you go? You dare? I’ll carry you home!”

“Listen, Razumihin,” Raskolnikov said, voice low. “I don’t want your help. It’s a burden.”

“Why did you seek me out?” Razumihin pressed.

“Maybe I wanted to die. Your kindness tortures me! Zossimov left to avoid irritating me. Leave me alone!”

“Let me be!” Raskolnikov gasped, his calm shattered.

Razumihin paused, then let his hand drop. 

“Well, go to hell then,” he murmured.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov expresses his frustration with Razumihin's attempts to help him, insisting that he prefers solitude over unwanted kindness.
